page.title: 14Pitsea Health Clinic.
page.content: Pitsea clinic is next to Pitsea School.Suzanne Hayden and I went to interview the clinic's receptionist. She told us that the clinic opened before 1940.She said that they would like a new clinic.Basildon Council built the clinic.She thinks that she has been there the longest, which is 10 years.She is in charge. About 330 outsiders were injected in 1984.She enjoys working there.The services they do are:dental,weighing, babies,schools,teaching women expecting babies,checking babies,smear tests, family planning so women can't have children,hearing tests,and test children who are going to a special school.She said the best thing about the clinic is people like coming because it is nice and friendly. Rosalind Walker.
